name: Grupo Compostela de Universidades
headAddress: Casa da Cuncha - rúa da Conga, 1
goal:
The Compostela Group of Universities (CGU) is a network of universities created around the values of the Way to Santiago. It seeks to facilitate and to promote cooperation among universities and stakeholders involved in Higher Education.

The CGU has the following mission:
1. To promote and organize mobility actions which enable the CGU community to face new challenges in a global and changeable working environment;
2. To promote and facilitate cooperation among member universities and other public and private stakeholders, aiming to contribute to the quality and innovation in Higher Education;
3. To foster respect and dissemination of European Values in Higher Education;
4. To promote and organize activities intended to protect and preserve the cultural heritage connected to the Way to Santiago and to other routes of Culture and Knowledge;

Membership reflects the diversity of higher education systems and is open to Institutions in Europe and beyond who share the group’s ideals.
interests: Culture, Education and training, External Relations, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
The Compostela Group is currently partner or associate partner in the following projects:
1) EVALUATE - Evaluating and Upscaling Tele Collaborative Teacher Education (582934-EPP-1-2016-2-ES-EPPKA2-EPPKA3-PI-POLICY)
2) GALEUROPA - Translational Youth Mobility co-financed by the Youth Employment Initiative and the European Social Fund through the Galician regional government Xunta de Galicia (2018/B/010)
3) ITINERARIUM ANTONINI, section RESTART"Research, Sustainable Economy, Tourism and Environment for Territorial Reactivation"
4) EWP 2.0 - Erasmus Without Papers 2.0 (Erasmus+ KA3)
5) TIGRIS-Transfer of Good practices & Reinforcement of Internationalization Strategies in Kurdistan (Erasmus+ KA2)
